author: Q U A S A R
title: Pharo - ACM
description: DeFi/Cryppto/Cardano is not mainstream and it is difficult to onboard new people into the crypto markets.

assessments.note: This "market" is not a positive way of scaling up DeFi. I do not like the idea of profiting from someone's loss.

Insurance is an indispensable part of a financial system. The proposal aims at building an insurance protocol for real life events. If successful, it should expand Cardano's DeFi ecosystem significantly.

The proposal presents minimal documentation for a protocol as complex as an Insurance AMM. The proposer should consider including a Whitepaper or technical docs describing the protocol mechanism design in detail.

The proposal focuses on bringing an innovative decentralized way to provide coverage in case a damaging event occurs. This proposal does not identify how this method of providing insurance will gain traction  and convert buyers from the current insurance providers. it also doesn't provide an estimate on the efficiency gains that this deployment might provide over traditional insurance providers beyond immediate payouts. will this result in less expensive insurance for the buyers?
COukld be an interesting idea. Not sure this directly meets the challenge. This is a specific DeFi proposal, not one to help scale up the DeFi ecosystem

There is no clarity in the purpose of the proposal. There is no detailed plan. The articles described are vague and do not explain in detail how the protocol works. The goals set are subjective and do not indicate how they will address the challenge.
The amount of experience on the team and presentation is very impressive. They clearly know the insurance world well and have experience with other blockchains.
The team have relevant experience in insurance and technology sectors. But the information is quite limited.
There is no basic technical documentation included, no benchmark/KPI to existing insurance protocol and the Budget timeline is lacking any semblance of detail.
the team has sufficient insurance experience and is working on an ETH deployment while also waiting for smart contracts on cardano.

Very light outline of a plan. It would be good to have mor einformation on the oracles and how you are going to validate the data. Data quality is integral to this working. It would also be good to have some evidence to back up the claimed experience of the proposer (LinkedIn profile?). Go to market strategy is stated as a strength, but not actually detailed.

The team stated that it will deliver a mvp to Ethereum in June, but in the articles and links described there is not enough information to assess the development of the project. In addition, there is no reasonable roadmap.

The proposal describes that it has a team with Cardano developers, but there is no information about the team's experience in Plutus.

The budget is divided into 3 parts (marketing, LP and team) but the proposal plan doesn't describe details about the project's development that indicates the feasibility of that budget.

I am still not clear why the person who's property suffers a loss does not have insurance. Is the MVP used instead of going through insurance? Is the property then used as collateral? Insurance is a dirty business, but maybe blockchain technology can help correct that. I am left with too many questions.

The proposal lacks technical details for assessment of its potential. For example, it is unclear under which mathematical construct the ACM will operate. Terms like MVP and UVP are left unexplained. And there are multiple typos, like "cryppto", "BUyers".
This proposal is an interesting concept but needs a lot more than a few 2 minute Medium articles as the technical documentation describing the system in detail.
this proposal provides sufficient information to assess the performance of the product.
A more detailed plan with milestones should be provided to allow progress auditing and layered release of funds. Details on methods to ensure data integrity of the oracles is essential.

There is no clarity as to the objective of the proposal and how it will address the challenge.

The indicators described in the timeline are subjective. There are no metrics/ KPIs. I recommend including a detailed plan and base the budget on that plan. The inclusion of this information is important for the auditability of the proposal.

There is no information about the team's knowledge in developing SCs in Plutus or Marlowe.

solution: Pharo engages the public w/auto cover maker that allows buyers to protect expenses and allows crowd-sourced liquidity and rev generation.
experience: 20+ years in insurance, 5+ years in blockchain, bvizdev, sysdev, product validation
